content:
Hey folks, this is a little tuning of the warnings inside the compose box. Let me know what do you think.
Another little thing to check out tricolon⁝ button instead of arrow down. I think its better but you might think that is not traditional :smile:
04-03-compose-warning.png 04-02-compose-warning.png 04-01-compose-warning.png 04-04-compose-warning.png

Why OK instead of X? Because there will be multiple X next to each other and this is not great. Also with OK warnings are more conversational and there might be another button there instead of OK, or no button at all.

Hm, interesting. What would it look like for the @-mention of someone who is not subscribed warning? Would you have the "Subscribe them" button followed by "OK"?

Another question for me is internationalization... "OK" is nice and short, but there may be languages where it would get translated to something significantly longer and less light-feeling (more like a "Confirm"), which may not feel as good.
Ok is international, no? I mean it could be in Russian for sure. Other languages… Something like “alright I got it”

I dunno how reliable this site, is, but after a bit of Googling around: https://www.indifferentlanguages.com/words/ok. Which is... mixed.

We could ask folks in #translation about it.
the only thing better than "Жарайды ма" is "болж байна уу". Anyway, we can fit any word or multiple on that button

@Vlad Korobov can you talk a bit about the motivation for wanting these error elements to be inside the compose box region rather than above them? I can see either way being reasonable, but we would more readily be able to keep the "X" button model with the current design where errors are outside.
And in addition to the i18n issues, I think I also prefer an "X" for hiding it just from a clutter standpoint -- having fewer fixed words on the screen seems nice.
If we are doing a string, some other options are "Hide" and "Dismiss", which might be semantically better than OK.
I thought about having it outside actually
I’ll show the version of such

Getting back on this. Here are the 4 types of toast messages with a button.
04-01-compose-toast-info.png 04-01-compose-toast-warning.png 04-01-compose-toast-danger.png 04-01-compose-toast-success.png

And here are the messages with a mixed content, including not themed text (black) and link (blue)
04-01-compose-toast-info-mixed.png 04-01-compose-toast-warning-mixed.png 04-01-compose-toast-danger-mixed.png 04-01-compose-toast-success-mixed.png

In this case there is a little nuance about attachment them to the compose box (back-drop effect between the toast and the compose box). For any general case such toast messages will probably be with a shadow.

These look pretty good to me!

On the engineering side, we'll probably want to do a bit of componentification of these notices, since currently they're using the Bootstrap alert class infrastructure, and we're hoping to stop using that.
https://chat.zulip.org/#narrow/stream/6-frontend/topic/banners

#22754, which redesigns most of the above-compose-box notices/warnings is being deployed here shortly. I don't expect folks to find many issues on chat.zulip.org, so I think it's decently likely I merge it in the next couple days if we don't get any bug reports, so that we can start finding issues from folks working in the development environment on main.

(An example thing you can do is try mentioning someone on a stream they are not subscribed to, if you want to see it in action).

Tim has pointed out this case:

image.png

@Vlad Korobov should the buttons be right aligned?
Test deploying this.
Yes @Evy as shown, they are right side aligned image.png
I think in the example you've showed the gap between X and the button should be smaller?
Yeah, I'll work on fixing that. Thanks for noticing it Tim!
Aha, found the issue -- the left part was growing properly some of the time but I missed a case. Pushed a fix.

I worry a bit that the gold color we have for this notice in the dark theme maybe feels a bit too bold for the "warning" class.

image.png
Certainly if one compares it with the yellow we have in the light theme, it feels a lot more scary/bold to me?

Evy said:

Aha, found the issue -- the left part was growing properly some of the time but I missed a case. Pushed a fix.

@Tim Abbott if you're doing another CZO deploy and it's easy to add this fix in, it's also ready to go
OK -- the changes here should be basically not something anyone will notice except if specifically trying to QA this, right? I might go with the strategy of just trying to merge it.
Yeah. And merging would be amazing, as it would make it easier to get the other banner PRs ready to go :)
Noting here that #19770 is likely either out of date or fixed from these updates (see #development help > question about issue #19770).
